item.title: Create Constraint Templates
item.description:
This section describes how to create a constraint template.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraint Templates in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Create on the page.

  4. In the Create Constraint Template dialog, set the name and targets of the constraint template, then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    CRD Name

item.title: View Constraint Template Details
item.description:
This section describes how to view constraint template details.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraint Templates in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click the name of a constraint template in the constraint template list to open its details page.

  4. In the Attributes area on the left side of the details page, view the basic information of the constraint template.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

    The cluster to which the constraint template belongs.

    Creation Time

    The creation time of the constraint template.

    CRD

    The CRD name corresponding to the constraint template.

item.title: Edit Constraint Template Configuration
item.description:
This section describes how to edit constraint template configuration.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraint Templates in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the constraint template you want to edit, then select Edit YAML from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Edit YAML dialog, modify the relevant configuration, then click OK.

item.title: Delete Constraint Templates
item.description:
This section describes how to delete a constraint template.

Warning

Constraint templates cannot be recovered after deletion. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • You should join a cluster and have the cluster-admin permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

  • Gatekeeper should have been installed and enabled.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the cluster-admin permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Gatekeeper > Constraint Templates in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click on the right side of the constraint template you want to delete, then select Delete from the dropdown list.

  4. In the Delete Constraint Template dialog, enter the name of the constraint template, then click OK.
